location_short_descr: The educational trail introduces you to the Olšany cemeteries, the largest contemporary cemetery in Prague on the site of the former settlement of Olšany...
location_long_descr:
The educational trail introduces you to the Olšany cemeteries, the largest contemporary cemetery in Prague on the site of the former settlement of Olšany, today between the districts of Žižkov and Vinohrady.
With its fifty hectares, the Olšan Cemetery is the largest burial ground in Prague . They consist of ten mortuary cemeteries and two municipal cemeteries. The oldest of them, Jednička, was founded after 1679 on the site of a large garden , which its owner from Olšany Jakub Štika sold to the Old Town Municipality so that it could bury victims of the plague.
Along with the plague cemetery , a chapel dedicated to the patron saint against the plague, St. Roch, St. Sebastian and St. Rosalie.
